intro: Rhynchotechum ellipticum var. saurauifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rhynchotechum, is a lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves that are often slightly hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
